column2: Aetna CEO says no decision yet on how to cover hepatitis C drugs Jan 13 The chief executive of health insurer Aetna Inc on Tuesday said that the company had not yet decided which hepatitis C drugs to cover now that there are two breakthrough treatments on the market
column3: but said that the company was actively working on a decision.

column2: Lilly to test combinations with Merck
column3: Bristol-Myers' cancer drugs Jan 13 Eli Lilly & Co signed two separate deals with Merck & Co Inc and Bristol-Myers Squibb Co to test combinations of its cancer treatments with two recently approved therapies that belong to a promising new class of drugs.

column2: J&J; in deal to develop microbiome drug for bowel diseases Jan 13 Johnson & Johnson on Tuesday announced a licensing deal with Vedanta Biosciences to develop the privately held company's lead microbiome-based drug candidate for inflammatory bowel disorders
column3: such as Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.

column2: Lilly to test combinations with Merck
column3: Bristol-Myers' cancer drugs Jan 13 Eli Lilly & Co signed two separate deals with Merck & Co Inc and Bristol-Myers Squibb Co to test combinations of its cancer treatments with two recently approved therapies that belong to a promising new class of drugs.

That's what makes MetLife's decision to take its watchdogs to court so surprising.UPDATE 3-U.S. insurer MetLife to sue regulators over high-risk tagU.S. insurer MetLife to sue regulators over high-risk tag WASHINGTON MetLife Inc on Tuesday sued U.S. regulators over a decision to subject the insurer to tougher oversight because it harbors enough risk to endanger the financial system if the next crisis hits. column2: EU vote gives governments the choice to grow GM cropsEU vote gives governments the choice to grow GM crops BRUSSELS Individual EU nations will be able to ban cultivation of genetically modified (GM) crops under a compromise deal agreed on Tuesday that ends years of deadlock over the barbed issue and could actually boost GM farming.  EU vote gives governments the choice to grow GM crops BRUSSELS Individual EU nations will be able to ban cultivation of genetically modified (GM) crops under a compromise deal agreed on Tuesday that ends years of deadlock over the barbed issue and could actually boost GM farming. column3: Jan 13 Royal Bank of Scotland  and Barclays may have to pay some of the biggest bills from an estimated $52 billion in fines and other litigation costs facing Europe's banks in the next two years

column2: Newfield Exploration says to retain China assets Jan 13 Oil and gas producer Newfield Exploration Co said it plans to retain its assets in China.

Verizon launches 'connected car' product for older vehicles Jan 13 Verizon Communications Inc  unveiled an Internet and wireless car service on Tuesday that lets drivers of older cars get help during a breakdown or find out about repairs and maintenance that might be needed.
